work.company: University of Ontario Institute of Technology
work.summary: CSCI1061, Programming Workshops II, is a second intensive course on computer programming (C++) that continues from CSCI 1060U and covers more advanced theory and practice. The lectures introduce modern concepts in program design and construction for larger scale programs and the laboratories provide an opportunity to apply these concepts. Topics that are covered in this course include advanced program design, design patterns, program refactoring, templates and standard template libraries, data structures, debugging and version control.
highlights: Deliver and present the students with the relevant content pertaining the current laboratory project.
Provide availabiltiy for office hours and drop-in for questions or concerns from students.

work.company: University of Ontario Institute of Technology
work.summary:
The International office, within the Office of the Vice-President, Research, Innovation and International, provides overall co-ordination of internationalization at UOIT, including strategic planning, faculty engagement and policy development. Operationally, the International office provides support for student exchange, visiting scholars, faculty mobility, and international partnership and program development.

Job tasks include all listed below and the following:
highlights: Administrator of health insurance for all international students (UHIP)
Responsible for the production of events, from conception through completion.

work.company: University of Ontario Institute of Technology
highlights: Elaboration of invitation letters for international visiting scholars interested in conducting research at the university.
Design of posters and flyers for advertisement purposes utilizing various graphics software
Creation and administration of forms for international visitors (scholars, delegations, partners), international, exchange, Science Without Borders students, among others.
Control of the International webpages under the UOIT website.
Contacting connections and setting up meetings.

education.institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology
courses: CSCI3070 - Design and Analysis of Algorithms

publications.name: dynOBD
publications.summary: Android application to keep track of statistics about any given car trip. It uses Bluetooth to connect to an OBDII (On-Board Diagnostics) device that is connected by the user to the car's DLC (Data Link Connector). It also provides a live data feed showing the current speed and throttle of the car.

publications.name: Graphizzer
publications.summary: Web-based application that, using the popular DOT notation, generates an accurate visualization by retrieving its image using the imgur API.

publications.name: CPU Capacity Comparisson
publications.summary: Determined the optimal amount of threads for specific mathematical calculations in relation to the number of iterations, magnitude of estimation error and CPU capacity.

publications.name: Simulated Banking System
publications.summary: Designed and implemented a Banking System in the form of a console application, following various software quality control aspects in the context of the Extreme Programming Process Model. The project uses a C++ automated teller machine terminal for simple banking transactions, while a Java batch processor maintains and updates the master account file in the back end.

publications.name: A-Priori and PCY Implementations
publications.summary: Conducted market-basket analysis by developing various efficient frequent itemsets algorithms on retail datasets. The algorithms were analysed and then compared in relation to their corresponding run times.
